title: Calories in Vape
meta_description: Discover calories in vape, including e-liquid nutrition facts, total energy, and why it's essentially zero—plus tweaks and FAQs for clarity.
assumptions: Standard e-cigarette or vape device use; per typical session (e.g., 1 ml e-liquid); common ingredients like PG/VG, flavorings, nicotine—no food additives.
disclaimer: Vaping products aren't food; calorie content is negligible and varies by e-liquid composition, brand, and usage. Not for ingestion—consult health experts.

quick_answer.text: Vaping has essentially 0 calories as e-liquids provide no significant nutritional energy.

label_note: Values reflect non-nutritive nature; no standard Nutrition Facts apply as vaping isn't dietary.

tweaks.label: Flavored e-liquid (e.g., fruit or dessert) vs. unflavored

faqs.q: Are there calories in vape e-liquid?
faqs.a: No, e-liquids have 0 calories; they're not designed for nutritional intake.

faqs.q: Does vaping fruit-flavored juice add calories?
faqs.a: Flavors are synthetic or minimal; still 0 significant calories per ml.

faqs.q: What about sugar in vape liquids?
faqs.a: Most have 0 g sugars; any sweeteners are non-caloric or trace amounts.

faqs.q: Is vaping a source of carbs or protein?
faqs.a: No carbs, protein, or fats—vape ingredients like PG/VG aren't metabolized as food.

faqs.q: Why search for calories in vape?
faqs.a: Common misconception; vaping doesn't contribute to caloric intake like food or drinks.
